docs.snippet: The government-backed Russian Direct Investment Fund is in the spotlight for making a big loan to Sibur, two of whose major owners have ties to President Vladimir Putin....
docs.lead_paragraph: The government-backed Russian Direct Investment Fund is in the spotlight for making a big loan to Sibur, two of whose major owners have ties to President Vladimir Putin.
docs.abstract: Government-backed Russian Direct Investment Fund is in spotlight for making $1.75 billion loan to country's largest petrochemical company Sibur, which has close ties to Pres Vladimir V Putin; Kirill Dmitriev, chief executive of fund, argues that loan followed investment's guidelines, and was commercially, not politically, motivated.

headline.main: Russian Fund Under Scrutiny for Loan to Company Linked to Kremlin
headline.print_headline: All in the Family, Russian Style

docs.snippet: The Litvinenko killing was old school. Russia is now relying on character assassination online to attack opponents with impunity....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Litvinenko killing was old school. Russia is now relying on character assassination online to attack opponents with impunity.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Mark Galeotti observes report of British inquiry into assassination of Russian defector Alexander V Litvinenko comes at time when it is clear Russian security forces have realized political costs of assassinations are too high; notes information operations have surpassed spies and assassins as state weapons in Russia and says world of cyberwarfare is new arena for Russia's covert wars.

headline.main: Who Needs Assassins When You’ve Got Hackers?

docs.snippet: Strikes and protests by workers have cropped up as the Russian government cut salaries and subsidies in response to plunging oil revenues....
docs.lead_paragraph: Strikes and protests by workers have cropped up as the Russian government cut salaries and subsidies in response to plunging oil revenues.
docs.abstract: Illegal wildcat strikes and unauthorized protests take place throughout Russia as government continues to cut salaries and subsidies in response to plunging oil revenues; oil fell below $30 per barrel in January 2016, and ruble hit record low of nearly 85 to dollar before slight recovery began.

headline.main: Russians’ Anxiety Swells as Oil Prices Collapse
headline.print_headline: Plunging Oil Prices Feed Worker Unrest in Russia

byline.contributor: Alexandra Odynova contributed reporting from Krasnodar, and Ivan Nechepurenko from Moscow.

docs.snippet: Syrian opposition groups said Saturday it is "impossible" to begin a negotiating process with the government without the implementation of U.N. resolutions pertaining to humanitarian issues, and denounced what they said were Russian "dictates" to ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Syrian opposition groups said Saturday it is "impossible" to begin a negotiating process with the government without the implementation of U.N. resolutions pertaining to humanitarian issues, and denounced what they said were Russian "dictates" to the opposition negotiating team.

headline.main: Rebels: Government, Russia Responsible if Peace Talks Fail
headline.print_headline: Rebels: Government, Russia Responsible if Peace Talks Fail

docs.snippet: Syrian armed rebel groups said on Saturday they held the Syrian government and Russia responsible for any failure of peace talks to end the country's civil war, even before negotiations due to start in Geneva next week....
docs.lead_paragraph: Syrian armed rebel groups said on Saturday they held the Syrian government and Russia responsible for any failure of peace talks to end the country's civil war, even before negotiations due to start in Geneva next week.

headline.main: Syrian Rebel Groups Hold Assad, Russia Responsible for Any Failure of Talks: Statement

docs.snippet: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei on Saturday called for closer economic and security ties with China, saying Iran had never trusted the West, as the two countries agreed to increase bilateral trade more than 10-fold to $600 billion in ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei on Saturday called for closer economic and security ties with China, saying Iran had never trusted the West, as the two countries agreed to increase bilateral trade more than 10-fold to $600 billion in the next decade.

headline.main: Iran's Leader Says Never Trusted the West, Seeks Closer Ties With China
headline.print_headline: Iran's Leader Says Never Trusted the West, Seeks Closer Ties With China

docs.snippet: The United States is not close to an agreement with China on new United Nations Security Council measures to impose on North Korea over its fourth nuclear test earlier this month, said U.S. Ambassador to the United Nations, Samantha Power, on Satu...
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States is not close to an agreement with China on new United Nations Security Council measures to impose on North Korea over its fourth nuclear test earlier this month, said U.S. Ambassador to the United Nations, Samantha Power, on Saturday.

headline.main: U.S. Says Not Close to Deal With China on North Korea at U.N.
headline.print_headline: U.S. Says Not Close to Deal With China on North Korea at U.N.

docs.snippet: Senior Saudi and Iranian figures clashed behind closed doors at a private meeting convened by the World Economic Forum in Davos this week to try to promote peace in Syria, participants said....

docs.snippet: Johanna Konta spurned the country of her birth to play tennis for Britain but the Sydney-born 24-year-old has enjoyed huge support from the Melbourne Park crowds during her run to the Australian Open fourth round....
docs.lead_paragraph: Johanna Konta spurned the country of her birth to play tennis for Britain but the Sydney-born 24-year-old has enjoyed huge support from the Melbourne Park crowds during her run to the Australian Open fourth round.
